704586f-a.text:
Fulton Street, at the N.E. corner of Crescent Street. The corner building which faces both Fulton and Crescent Streets, are Nos. 3345-3351 and 229-233 respectively. The Fulton Street Elcvated structure turns into Crescent Street, at this point. This building once known as the Lafayette Votel (saloon) was operated by a Captain Hy. Koerner and later his widow, from 1872-1902. It was later known as Starks Old Roadhouse when it was
damaged by fire on February 18, 1922.
June 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
